backend-dev-guidelines.description: Backend development patterns for Go/Echo/PostgreSQL in listmonk

handlers.location: cmd/ directory organized by domain (campaigns.go, subscribers.go, etc.)
handlers.pattern: Handler methods take echo.Context, call core functions, return error
handlers.errorHandling: Return echo.NewHTTPError(statusCode, message) or core errors directly

core.usage: Called by handlers, performs validation and DB operations
core.example: Returns errors that can be directly used in HTTP responses

models.location: models/ - data structures and query management
files: models.go - Core structs (Subscriber, Campaign, List, etc.)
queries.go - Database query loader using goyesql

queries.location: queries.sql - All SQL queries in one file
queries.pattern: Named queries with -- name: query-name markers
queries.loading: Loaded via goyesql into models.Queries struct

handlerPattern.description: HTTP handlers bind params, validate, call core, return errors

corePattern.description: Core functions validate, query DB, return echo.HTTPError

queryPattern.description: Add queries to queries.sql with -- name: marker
queryPattern.code:
-- name: get-resource
SELECT * FROM resources WHERE id = $1;

messengerPattern.interface: Name() string, Push(models.Message) error, Flush() error, Close() error

queries.location: queries.sql only - do not inline SQL in .go files

schema.file: schema.sql - source of truth for DB structure
schema.testing: Use --install for fresh DB, --upgrade for migrations

errorHandling.logging: Use app.log for logging, not fmt.Println

commonMistakes: ‚ùå Don't inline SQL - add to queries.sql instead
‚ùå Don't mutate settings without UPDATE query
‚ùå Don't forget to register migrations in migList
‚ùå Don't use ? placeholders - use $1, $2 for PostgreSQL
‚ùå Don't call DB directly in handlers - use core functions
‚úÖ DO return core errors directly from handlers
‚úÖ DO use goyesql queries from queries.sql
‚úÖ DO validate input before calling core functions
‚úÖ DO make migrations idempotent (IF NOT EXISTS, etc.)

tools.framework: Echo v4 - HTTP routing and middleware
tools.database: sqlx - SQL toolkit with struct scanning

backend-dev-guidelines.suggestMessage:
üí° Backend Development Guidelines for listmonk (Go/Echo/PostgreSQL)

üìÇ ARCHITECTURE:
- cmd/ - HTTP handlers (echo.Context, return errors)
-internal/core/ - Business logic (validation, DB operations)
- models/ - Data structures and query loader
- queries.sql - All SQL queries with -- name: markers
-internal/migrations/ - Version-specific migrations

üîß COMMON PATTERNS:
1. Handler ‚Üí Core ‚Üí Database
2. Return echo.HTTPError from core functions
3. Access queries via app.queries.QueryName
4. Log with app.log, not fmt.Println
5. Add SQL to queries.sql, not inline

üìö REFERENCE FILES:
- cmd/campaigns.go - HTTP handler example
-internal/core/campaigns.go - Business logic example
- queries.sql - Query naming and structure
- internal/migrations/v6.0.0.go - Migration pattern

frontend-dev-guidelines.description: Vue 2.7 + Buefy + Bulma best practices for listmonk frontend development
frontend-dev-guidelines.blockMessage:
‚ö†Ô∏è BLOCKED - Vue 2.7 + Buefy Frontend Guidelines Required

üìã REQUIRED ACTION:
1. Use Skill tool: 'frontend-dev-guidelines'
2. Review Vue 2.7 Options API patterns (data(), computed, methods)
3. Use Buefy components (b-button, b-field, b-input, etc.)
4. Use Bulma CSS classes for layout (columns, section, is-*, has-*)
5. Follow existing patterns in frontend/src/views/ and frontend/src/components/

‚ö†Ô∏è COMMON MISTAKES TO AVOID:
- ‚ùå Don't use Vue 3 Composition API (setup(), ref(), reactive())
- ‚ùå Don't use React/JSX patterns or MUI components
- ‚ùå Don't use raw HTML buttons when b-button exists
- ‚ùå Don't mutate Vuex state directly (use actions/mutations)
- ‚ùå Don't forget 'scoped' in <style scoped> for component styles

‚úÖ CORRECT PATTERNS:
- Use Vue.extend() for component definitions
- Use this.$buefy.toast.open() for notifications
- Use this.$api for HTTP requests
- Use this.$t() for i18n translations
- Use mapState/mapActions from Vuex
- Use Buefy's programmatic APIs (this.$buefy.dialog.confirm())

File: {file_path}

üí° TIP: Reference existing components for patterns:
- frontend/src/views/Logs.vue (simple page with Buefy)
- frontend/src/components/LogView.vue (presentational component)
- frontend/src/views/Campaign.vue (complex form with validation)

vuePatterns.data: Always return object from data() function
vuePatterns.computed: Use computed for derived state, not methods

stateManagement.read: Use mapState in computed or this.$store.state
stateManagement.write: Use mapActions in methods or this.$store.dispatch

migration-deployment-guidelines.description: Migration and deployment best practices for listmonk (database migrations, Docker builds, Azure deployment)
migration-deployment-guidelines.blockMessage:
üö® CRITICAL - Migration & Deployment Guidelines Required

‚ö†Ô∏è STOP: Migrations and deployments can cause data loss or downtime if done incorrectly.

üìã REQUIRED CHECKLIST BEFORE PROCEEDING:

1Ô∏è‚É£ DATABASE MIGRATIONS:
   ‚úì Migration is idempotent (uses IF NOT EXISTS, IF EXISTS, etc.)
   ‚úì Migration file named v{major}.{minor}.{patch}.go
   ‚úì Registered in cmd/upgrade.go migList array
   ‚úì schema.sql updated with final state
   ‚úì Tested with --upgrade on dev database
   ‚úì No data loss - consider backfilling existing data

2Ô∏è‚É£ DOCKER BUILDS:
   ‚úì Multi-stage build optimized (email-builder ‚Üí frontend ‚Üí backend ‚Üí final)
   ‚úì Frontend built before backend
   ‚úì Static assets copied to correct locations
   ‚úì Image size reasonable (<500MB compressed)
   ‚úì Health checks functional

3Ô∏è‚É£ AZURE DEPLOYMENT:
   ‚úì Migrations run BEFORE container deployment
   ‚úì Environment variables set correctly
   ‚úì New revision created with timestamp suffix
   ‚úì Previous revision kept for quick rollback
   ‚úì Database backup taken before schema changes

4Ô∏è‚É£ TESTING:
   ‚úì Built and tested locally first
   ‚úì Migrations tested on copy of production data
   ‚úì Rollback plan documented
   ‚úì No breaking API changes without version bump

File: {file_path}

üí° USE: Deploy checklist in deploy.sh comments

structure.function: func up{Version}(db *sqlx.DB, fs stuffbin.FileSystem, prompt bool) error
structure.idempotency: MUST use IF NOT EXISTS, IF EXISTS to make repeatable

registration.order: Add to END of migList (chronological order)

schemaSync.requirement: MUST update schema.sql to reflect final state after migration
schemaSync.testing: --install should create same schema as running all migrations

commonPatterns.addTable: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS table_name (...)
commonPatterns.addColumn: ALTER TABLE table_name ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS column_name type
commonPatterns.addIndex: CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_name ON table_name(column)
commonPatterns.backfillData: UPDATE table SET new_col = old_col WHERE new_col IS NULL
commonPatterns.renameColumn: ALTER TABLE table RENAME COLUMN old TO new (if supported), otherwise add new + copy + drop old

dangerZone: ‚ùå NEVER DROP TABLE without confirmation prompt
‚ùå NEVER ALTER COLUMN TYPE without data migration plan
‚ùå NEVER DROP COLUMN without verifying no code references it
‚ùå NEVER run migration without testing on production-like data
‚úì ALWAYS take database backup before schema changes
‚úì ALWAYS make migrations reversible when possible

optimization.layerCaching: Copy dependency files first, then source code
optimization.multiStage: Only final stage artifacts in production image
optimization.alpineBase: Use alpine for small image size

dockerBuilds.testing: docker build -f Dockerfile.build -t listmonk:test . && docker run -it listmonk:test /listmonk --version

steps.name: Run migrations
steps.important: MUST run BEFORE deploying new container

rollback.command: az containerapp revision list && az containerapp revision activate --revision <name>
rollback.database: If migration ran, may need database restore

frontend.emailBuilder: cd frontend/email-builder && yarn install && yarn build
frontend.main: cd frontend && yarn install && yarn build
frontend.verify: Check dist/ for index.html and static/ directory

backend.flags: -ldflags for version string and build info

assetEmbedding.files: Frontend dist, static/, i18n/, SQL files
assetEmbedding.distribution: Single binary with all assets embedded

migrationFailures.notIdempotent: Migration fails on second run - use IF NOT EXISTS
migrationFailures.missingInMigList: Migration file exists but not registered
migrationFailures.dataLoss: Dropped column still referenced in code

dockerBuildFailures.wrongOrder: Backend built before frontend - dependency issue
dockerBuildFailures.missingArtifacts: COPY fails because previous stage didn't produce output
dockerBuildFailures.cacheInvalidation: Changed dependency files invalidate all subsequent layers
dockerBuildFailures.imageSize: Image too large - forgot to use multi-stage build

deploymentFailures.migrationNotRun: New code expects schema changes that don't exist
deploymentFailures.envVarMissing: Container crashes due to missing required env var
deploymentFailures.healthCheckFails: Container starts but health endpoint returns error
deploymentFailures.revisionNotActive: New revision created but old one still serving traffic
